page.title: 08TRAFFIC SURVEY
page.content: A first year class from Toot Hill School conducted a detailed survey of the traffic that passed through Bingham at three different times of the day. The survey took place at the traffic lights on the main A52 road and the number of vehicles and the direction they were taking were noted. In all 1874 vehicles were counted. The busiest time was from 10.20 to 10.50 in the morning. Over 300 lorries, 250 vans and 1200 cars were counted. Most of these vehicles were just passing through Bingham. This main road is extremely dangerous and difficult to cross and a bypass is planned with work due to start in 1986.
